image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: Authorities are offering the largest reward in Victoria's history for information leading to the arrest of Dezi Freeman, as the hunt for alleged killer enters its 12th day.

title.children: Victoria Police offer $1m reward for information on Dezi Freeman

image.altText: a view of St Patrick's Catholic cathedral in East Melbourne

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation can reveal the Catholic Church tried to revive a highly controversial legal loophole that stopped it from being sued by victims of sexual abuse for millions of dollars in damages, after it was scrapped in 2018.

title.children: Catholic Church tried to revive outlawed legal loophole in abuse case

image.altText: Two protesters holding signs that read 'save our pool'.

props.synopsis: The Australian Medical Association has urged the state government to intervene in a Melbourne council's decision to close a swimming pool, warning of "serious and predictable" health consequences.

title.children: AMA calls on local council to reverse decision to close swimming pool

image.altText: David Swallow shouts to celebrate a goal in an AFL elimination final.

props.synopsis: David Swallow kicks a behind with nine seconds left to hand the Suns a one-point win over Fremantle in an epic elimination final. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Suns veteran kicks game-winner with nine seconds left against Freo

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The kick that won the game

image.altText: A man looks on during an A-League Men's match

props.synopsis: Western United's players are officially free agents with the club to be placed on ice for the next 12 months as they attempt to stave off extinction.

title.children: Western United enter hibernation as wind-up drags on

image.altText: Two women standing beside a man in front of a tram talking to each other

props.synopsis: Melbourne's best tram drivers are getting ready for a trip to Vienna to compete in the inaugural World Tramdriver Championship.

title.children: Cheers and skittles for tram drivers on track for world championships

image.altText: The silhouette of a person holding a football.

props.synopsis: As football teams across Victoria gear up for finals season, a different kind of preparation is underway in the state's domestic violence support services.

title.children: Domestic violence support services brace for football finals spike

image.altText: A fallen power pole lies on the ground in central western NSW.

props.synopsis: Early Fault Detection technology has been trialled in several Australian states but a national rollout is a long way off.

title.children: Device detects power line faults before disaster strikes

image.altText: A woman with straight, black, long hair smiles. There are plants behind her.

props.synopsis: Ararat, like most regional towns, has an ageing population and a drift of young people to the cities. But a migrant resettlement program is reinvigorating the town.

title.children: Migrants and refugees thrive in jobs locals 'not comfortable doing'

image.altText: A family at the kitchen table crowd around a birthday cake for a one year old in a vintage film photo.

props.synopsis: Some memories fade away, while others stay with us for life. But why can we remember some things and not others? And can you "make" a memory? This is what the experts say.

title.children: Do core memories really exist? We asked the experts

image.altText: A painting of a green valley with shrubs on the side and a mountain in the background, in an ornate gold frame.g

props.synopsis: Russian artist Nicholas Chevalier's now-famous painting of Mt Abrupt in western Victoria is being used by a revegetation group to reflect the landscape as the artist saw it in 1864.

title.children: Clues in 161-year-old painting help restore Grampians' native beauty

image.altText: A machete

props.synopsis: Victoria's ban on machetes has begun, but a closer look at the law behind it reveals a broad definition for them.

title.children: Victoria's machete ban creates confusion over knife definition

image.altText: A man uses a small electrical device to zap a racehorse as it runs on a treadmill.

props.synopsis: The newly released footage from 2018 shows now-barred trainer Darren Weir applying the "jigger" to a horse on a treadmill.

title.children: Tribunal releases video of top trainer using shock device on horse

image.altText: A woman standing inside an unfinished house

props.synopsis: Prosecutions against home builders are rising sharply in Victoria, with the new regulator warning consumer protection measures will be "on steroids".

title.children: Scores of builders facing prosecution as new watchdog bares teeth

image.altText: A sad-looking Brisbane AFL player wearing a training jacket stands on the MCG after a finals loss.

props.synopsis: Brisbane's premiership defence is on shaky ground after losing star midfielder Lachie Neale to a likely season-ending injury in their qualifying final defeat.

title.children: Lions 'not expecting great news' on premiership star after finals loss

image.altText: Cartons of eggs on a supermarket shelf.

props.synopsis: Coles says the cost of living and supply chain disruptions are behind its decision to continue selling caged eggs until 2030. A consumer expert says it is likely the supermarket's competitors will follow suit.

title.children: Coles abandons plan to stop selling caged eggs by end of year

image.altText: Penny Wong sits at a table alongside other officials, talking in a microphone to someone across the table.

props.synopsis: Australia is responding to China's display of military power by building closer ties with partners like Japan and racing to "modernise and build our defence force", Richard Marles says, as Penny Wong cautions Daniel Andrews over his decision to attend.

title.children: Australia racing to 'modernise' defence force after show from China: Marles

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Thomas Sewell will remain behind bars until he faces court on charges related to an attack on Camp Sovereignty over the weekend.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader denied bail over Camp Sovereignty attack

image.altText: Man standing in sheep yards with sheep

props.synopsis: The Victorian government says it cannot confirm how many sheep and lambs have been killed by dingoes in the state's north-west since it introduced restrictions on lethal control measures.

title.children: 'Defeated' Victorian farmers look for answers as livestock losses mount

image.altText: A man runs the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Storm continue to count the cost of its loss to Brisbane with Ryan Papenhuyzen and Nelson-Asofa-Solomona set to miss next week's final against Canterbury, and Jahrome Hughes confirmed to have suffered a fractured forearm.

title.children: Finals disaster strikes Storm with star duo set to join Hughes on sidelines

image.altText: A group of people standing for a photo

props.synopsis: The former Victorian premier has defended a decision to travel to China for a military commemorative event, saying a constructive relationship with Australia's largest trading partner was in the country's national interest.

title.children: Daniel Andrews addresses controversial Beijing group photo

image.altText: A serious Matthew Nicks talks to his players during a break in a game. He is bald and is wearing a multi-coloured tee.

props.synopsis: Adelaide fans are threatening to cancel their memberships after a Collingwood star was targeted during the AFL qualifying final.

title.children: 'I felt ashamed': Crows fans hit out at homophobic slurs during QF

image.altText: An accident scene with police and vehicles.

props.synopsis: Police say the two women were struck by a vehicle on the Hume Freeway at Craigieburn on Thursday night.

title.children: Two women killed while trying to help injured animal on Melbourne freeway

image.altText: An image of a potato cut in half with rust coloured arcs inside on its flesh.

props.synopsis: Victoria, New South Wales and South Australia have placed restrictions on the importation of unprocessed Tasmanian potatoes, following the island state's outbreak of mop-top virus.

title.children: Ban on potato exports from Tasmania to Vic, NSW, SA over mop-top virus

image.altText: A former AFL coach speaks behind a microphone in 2017.

props.synopsis: AFL premiership coach Mick Malthouse recounts the terrifying moment three masked men attempted to break into his East Melbourne apartment.

title.children: 'It went into the chest': Malthouse recounts terrifying home invasion

image.altText: A colourful processional dragon inside a museum dedicated to Chinese artefacts.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne couple accused of damaging numerous precious items in Bendigo by "sprinkling" vegetable oil thought the substance would simply wash off, a court has been told.

title.children: Alleged vandals were 'blessing' historic artefacts with oil, court hears

image.altText: A group of men wearing black.

props.synopsis: Police have charged another three men with offences related to the attack on Camp Sovereignty over the weekend, bringing the total number of men charged to seven. Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell is being held in custody over the incident.

title.children: More arrests over Camp Sovereignty attack that left multiple people injured

image.altText: A dead fish on a river bank

props.synopsis: The Anglesea River — a tourism drawcard on the Surf Coast and place of pride for locals — has seen repeat fish kills in recent years, with both residents and experts at a loss as to restore the river's health.

title.children: The neon green river killing fish on Victoria's surf coast

image.altText: A couple stand in an apartment looking into camera with a serious expression. One is holding a cat.

props.synopsis: A year after they moved into an "affordable" apartment in a new public-private housing development in inner Melbourne, Alix and Tiarn were told their rent would increase by 17 per cent. They say their experience highlights flaws in the model the Victorian government is using to redevelop its aging public housing towers.

title.children: 'Affordable' housing tenants face $55 per week rent increase

image.altText: A LGBTQIA+ flag blowing in the wind by the Murray River.

props.synopsis: With few public LGBTQIA+ celebrations in Mildura, a community campaign for a mardi gras is gaining momentum.

title.children: Mildura considers hosting Murray River mardi gras

image.altText: A bidder throws up a H sign at an auction

props.synopsis: Some of Victoria's most exclusive heritage number plates have new owners after an auction saw buyers spend millions of dollars.

title.children: Victorian number plate sells for $650k as buyers spend big at auction

image.altText: A young boy smiling

props.synopsis: A woman who lost control of her SUV and crashed into a group of students at Auburn South Primary School, killing a boy, has been convicted and fined $2,000.

title.children: Driver fined $2,000 and disqualified after death of Melbourne student

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: As the search for Dezi Freeman continues, former police officers say the public should not be surprised if it goes on for months.

title.children: Former officers say police have the advantage in Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: Crows player Izak Rankine in casual clothes.

props.synopsis: Adelaide Crows head coach Matthew Nicks has said suspended star Izak Rankine is "in a pretty good space" following his return to the club after an overseas break.

title.children: Rankine addresses Crows teammates after returning from overseas break

image.altText: A photo showing Ibac Independent Broad-Based Anti-Corruption Commission Victoria on the windows of its Victorian office.

props.synopsis: A former councillor has been charged with receiving secret commissions and misconduct in public office while a property development consultant has been charged with giving secret commissions.

title.children: Two charged after corruption investigation into Melbourne council
